summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 18177, entitled, "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Eighteenth Avenue Northwest, from West Sixty-fifth Street to West Seventy-fifth Street; Seventeenth Avenue Northwest, from West Sixty-seventh Street to West Seventy-fifth Street; Sixteenth Avenue Northwest, from West Sixty-seventh Street to West Seventy-fifth Street; West Seventieth Street, from Fifteenth Avenue Northwest to Nineteenth Avenue Northwest; and West Seventy-third Street, from Fifteenth Avenue Northwest to Nineteenth Avenue Northwest, all in the City of Seattle, by grading and curbing the same and constructing concrete walks, with all necessary appurtenances, in accordance with Resolution No. 1199 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle," approved on the Seventh day of April, 1908.
